author: Doug Cameron
title: Delta Faces New International Challenge
text:
Delta Air Lines Inc. said international travel boosted profits in the latest quarter as the industry faces a potential shakeout of the Trans-Atlantic market following a rivalâ€™s interest in buying a fast-growing low-cost carrier.
Buoyant demand from business travelers and a weaker U.S. dollar have boosted international sales for airlines including Delta, the largest U.S. operator on flights to and from Europe.
